TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit ProjectInstance extends System.Object

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Diagnostics.DebuggerDisplay("{FullPath} #Targets={TargetsCount} DefaultTargets={(DefaultTargets == null) ? System.String.Empty : System.String.Join(";", DefaultTargets.ToArray())} ToolsVersion={Toolset.ToolsVersion} InitialTargets={(InitialTargets == null) ? System.String.Empty : System.String.Join(";", InitialTargets.ToArray())} #GlobalProperties={globalProperties.Count} #Properties={properties.Count} #ItemTypes={items.ItemTypes.Count} #Items={items.Count}")

Docs.summary: Represents a project instance.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Instances of this class result when a project is cloned. Constructors are internal in order to require users to create project instances from existing projects.
New project instances are immutable, except that instance items can be added to them and instance properties set on them. Project instances are useful because they can be modified and built several times without disturbing the original project.
Neither this class nor any of its constituents is allowed to have references to <xref:Microsoft.Build.Construction> or <xref:Microsoft.Build.Evaluation> objects.
Project instance targets, host services, and the task registry are not exposed.

Docs.summary: Creates a new project instance.

Docs.param: The project root element.
Docs.summary: Creates a new project instance and initializes it from the given project root, using the default project collection.

remarks.format: ## Remarks No intermediate <xref:Microsoft.Build.Evaluation.Project> object is created. This is useful if a project is going to be built, but not displayed or edited.

Docs.summary: Creates an independent, deep clone of this project and everything in it. Useful for compiling a single file or for keeping build results between builds.

Docs.summary: Creates an independent, deep clone of this project and everything in it. Clone has the same mutability as the original. Useful for compiling a single file or for keeping build results between builds.
Docs.returns: Creates an independent, deep clone of this project.

Docs.summary: Creates an independent, deep clone of this project and everything in it, with specified mutability. Useful for compiling a single file or for keeping build results between builds.
Docs.returns: An independent, deep clone of this project, with specified mutability.

Attribute.AttributeName: get: System.Diagnostics.DebuggerStepThrough
get: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.summary: Gets the project root directory. Used for evaluation of relative paths and setting the current directory during build. Is never null: projects not loaded from disk use the current directory from the time the build started.
Docs.value: The project root directory, which is never null. Projects not loaded from disk return the current directory at the time the build was started.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance bool EvaluateCondition(string condition) cil managed
Public Function EvaluateCondition (condition As String) As Boolean
abstract member EvaluateCondition : string -> bool override this.EvaluateCondition : string -> bool

Docs.param: The string to be expanded.
Docs.summary: Evaluates the provided string as a condition by expanding items and properties, using the current items and properties available, then doing a logical evaluation.
Docs.returns: if the string evaluates to true; otherwise, .

remarks.format:
## Remarks This is useful for the immediate window.
Does not expand bare metadata expressions.
